body: This code is intended to be guarded behind `--define=systemd` in bazel builds. Are you using cmake? gRPC is built with `-DHAVE_LIBSYSTEMD` if systemd libraries are found via cmake. If that's the case, our cmake configuration probably needs to check for a library version.

issue.title: error: ‘sd_is_socket_sockaddr’ was not declared in this scope

repository.name: grpc
repository.description: C++ based gRPC (C++, Python, Ruby, Objective-C, PHP, C#)

issue.body:
### What version of gRPC and what language are you using?

Latest release tag (v1.52.1).

### What operating system (Linux, Windows,...) and version?

CentOS 7

### What runtime / compiler are you using (e.g. python version or version of gcc)

gcc-11 (devtoolset-11)

### What did you do?

This is a recent regression, probably within 1 month as we were able to build late Jan (for v1.51.1, the latest release at that time).
We're now getting a build failure on CentOS.

body: Regardless of bazel or cmake, CentOS 7 has systemd for sure and it's one of the initial adopter.

`sd_is_socket_sockaddr` was added in [systemd release v233](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/f6f372d2f46ac9be7cbb1ecd8f82f1b3ab669924). Centos7 distributes [libsystemd.so v229](https://centos.pkgs.org/7/centos-x86_64/systemd-libs-219-78.el7.x86_64.rpm.html). This should only be an issue for our cmake build, since bazel does not attempt library auto-detection.
https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/32671 might fix it. I don't have a centos7 machine to test on, @bxlxx and @xkszltl would you mind testing the PR to see if it fixes your build?

I'll see if I can find some spare cycles.
FYI you can always try it in centos7's docker.

> #32671 might fix it. I don't have a centos7 machine to test on, @bxlxx and @xkszltl would you mind testing the PR to see if it fixes your build?

I had similar pb with v1.55.0 and systemd v228 (opensuse 42.3 system)  . The PR fixed the problem.
Can also confirm the patch works for me on Centos.  Onto the next error, hey ho.
